str2: Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Large, great, in the widest sense.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Pharaoh, the title of ancient Egyptian kings. Of foreign origin; Pharao, an Egyptian king.
Apparently a primary word; a female child, or descendant.
